intro: Psychotria neurodictyon, commonly known as the "blue hoya," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Psychotria neurodictyon is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated as a houseplant in many parts of the world.
